intro: Lepisorus longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed moss fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, creeping rhizomes and its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. The fronds are typically slender and lanceolate, with a soft, velvety texture. This plant is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing on rocks or in shaded forest floors. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptability make it a notable species in the study of epiphytic and lithophytic plants.
